post.description: Authenticate using OAuth2 password grant flow to obtain an access token. Use the same endpoint to exchange your refresh_token for a new access_token if it's expired.

grant_type.description: Grant type. For password grant flow, this should be 'password'. For refresh token flow, it should be 'refresh_token'.

username.description: The user's username. Required only for the password flow.

password.description: The user's password. Required only for the password flow.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token. Required only for refresh token flow.

client_id.description: The client ID is representing the tenant to which the token will grant access.

access_token.description: The access token which can be used to authenticate subsequent API calls.

expires_in.description: The number of seconds until the access token expires.

refresh_expires_in.description: The number of seconds until the refresh token expires.

token_type.description: The type of the token - in this case always 'Bearer'.

refresh_token.description: Token that can be used to obtain a new access token when the current one expires.

scope.description: The scope for which the access token is valid. Defines the permissions granted by the token.

not-before-policy.description: A policy indicating the earliest time from which the token can be used. Represented as the number of seconds since the token's issue date.

session_state.description: Represents the state of the user's current session. Useful for managing and validating user sessions in the application.

400.description: Bad request. Invalid input or user credentials.

error.description: Error code representing the type of error.

error_description.description: A human-readable description of the error.

error.description: Error code representing the type of error.

error_description.description: A human-readable description of the error.
